_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Certification Statement:



Based on the criteria in 40 CFR 68.10, the distance to the specified endpoint for the worst case accidental release scenario for the following process is less than the distance to the nearest public receptor.



Process = Propane bulk storage tank at east side of property.



Within the past five years the process has had no accidental release that caused off site impacts provided in the Risk Management Plan program rule (40 CFR 68.10(b)(1).  No additional measures are necessary to prevent off site impacts from accidental releases.  In the event of fire, explosion, or a release of propane gas from the tanks, entry within the distance to the endpoint may pose a danger to the facility and public emergency responders.  Therefore, public responders should not enter this area except as arranged with the Emergency Contact(s) indicated in this Risk Management Plan.

Signature                    Printed Name



______________________________________    ________________________________

Title                         Date





Executive Summary:



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:  Intertractor America Corporation complies with National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) - 58 requirements for LP-Gas storage and it is its policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur it is the company's policy to notify the City of Elkhorn Fire Department and the Walworth County Division of Emergency Government and request they respond to the emergency.



Description of Facility and the Regulated Substance:  Intertractor America Corporation is a manufacturer of undercarriage product for construction equipment and uses propane gas as an alternate fuel source.  The propane gas is stored at the east side of the property in a series of four (4) 1,000 gallon bulk storage tanks.  The bulk storage tanks are filled by bulk transport trucks
at the tanks but the fuel dispensing lines are plumbed directly to the point of use and when the gas is transferred to the point of use it is  blended with air to more closely resemble natural gas.
